title.narrative: Bangladesh Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning (BMEL) Activity

description.narrative: (Bangladesh): The Bangladesh Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning contract provides monitoring, evaluation and learning (MEL) services across the USAID/Bangladesh Mission. The activity responds to the Mission's evolving need to consolidate third-party MEL services under a single and centrally managed platform as a way of streamlining collection and use of evidence-based performance data in programmatic decision-making.With FY 2020 funds, the activity will provide services that include, but are not limited to: field-based data quality assessments; customized geographic and sectoral assessments; mid-term and final performance evaluations; and, a limited number of impact evaluations. Together with these services, the activity will serve as a tool for continuous integration of collaborative learning, adaptation, and knowledge management into the entire Mission portfolio. Also, the activity will bolster monitoring and evaluation technical capacity of USAID staff, implementing partners, collaborating organizations, and Government of Bangladesh counterparts.This activity is the most-direct method to implement USAID evaluation policy requirements. This activity assures high-quality data and information is used to develop and assess the effectiveness of development programming in Bangladesh. The activity supports the U.S. National Security Strategy, the Global Food Security, the State-USAID Joint Strategic Plan Goals One and Two, and all U.S. government's mission objectives in Bangladesh.. .
